post.description:
Accepts content (text, audio link, etc.) for sentiment and toxicity analysis. Requires authentication via an X-API-Key header. The API key must be valid for the user and optionally linked to the specified gameId.

Server Context: Optional serverId parameter accepts unified server ID (works for both game servers and community servers).

Process:
1. Validates authentication via X-API-Key.
2. Verifies user owns the specified gameId (and the key is valid for the game if scoped).
3. Creates an analysis record in the database.
4. Queues the analysis task to a background worker via Celery.
5. Returns status 202 (Accepted) with the ID of the created analysis record.

rawContent.description: The actual text content if not fetching from URL.

sourcePlayerId.description: ID of the player who generated the content.

rawContent.description: The actual text content if not fetching from URL.

sourcePlayerId.description: ID of the player who generated the content.

rawContent.description: The actual text content if not fetching from URL.

sourcePlayerId.description: ID of the player who generated the content.

post.description: Internal webhook endpoint called by the analysis worker upon completion. Processes sentiment, toxicity, and feedback analysis results. Requires worker signature verification.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the sentiment analysis data record.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Fetches the original sentiment data along with its processed sentiment and toxicity results. Requires authentication via X-API-Key header, and returns data only if the API key is valid and associated with the user who owns the record.

post.description: Creates a new API key associated with the authenticated user (via Bearer token) and a specific game. Returns the key details including the one-time visible secret key value.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all active API keys associated with the authenticated user (via Bearer token). The secret key value hash is excluded.

delete.description: Soft-deletes an API key by its ID. Requires the authenticated user (via Bearer token) to own the key.

post.description: Creates a new game associated with the authenticated user (via Bearer token).

get.description: Retrieves a list of all games associated with the authenticated user (via Bearer token).
Retrieves details for a specific game owned by the authenticated user (via Bearer token).

delete.description: Deletes a game by its ID. Requires the authenticated user (via Bearer token) to own the game.

put.description: Updates details (name, description, gameType) for a specific game owned by the authenticated user (via Bearer token). Only provided fields are updated.

post.description: Creates a new server (game or community) for a game. Server type is determined by the serverType field. Game servers can include region, community servers require platform.

get.description: List all servers for a game. Optionally filter by serverType (GAME or COMMUNITY) using query parameter.
Retrieves a specific server (game or community) by its ID.

put.description: Updates a server (game or community) by its ID. Supports updating type-specific fields based on server type.

delete.description: Deletes a server (game or community) by its ID.

get.description: List and filter feedback across all games with pagination support
Get detailed information about a specific feedback item
